spreadsheet.SpreadsheetApp.name: SpreadsheetApp
spreadsheet.SpreadsheetApp.doc: Access and create Google Sheets files. This class is the parent class for the Spreadsheet service.

property.name: AutoFillSeries
property.doc: An enumeration of the types of series used to calculate auto-filled values.

property.name: BandingTheme
property.doc: An enumeration of the possible banding themes.

property.name: BooleanCriteria
property.doc: An enumeration of conditional formatting boolean criteria.

property.name: BorderStyle
property.doc: An enumeration of the valid styles for setting borders on a Range.

property.name: CopyPasteType
property.doc: An enumeration of the possible paste types.

property.name: DataValidationCriteria
property.doc: An enumeration representing the data validation criteria that can be set on a range.

property.name: Dimension
property.doc: An enumeration of the possible dimensions of a spreadsheet.

property.name: Direction
property.doc: A enumeration of the possible directions that one can move within a spreadsheet using the arrow keys.

property.name: GroupControlTogglePosition
property.doc: An enumeration of the positions that the group control toggle can be in.

property.name: InterpolationType
property.doc: An enumeration of conditional format gradient interpolation types.

property.name: PivotTableSummarizeFunction
property.doc: An enumeration of the functions that may be used to summarize values in a pivot table.

property.name: PivotValueDisplayType
property.doc: An enumeration of the ways that a pivot value may be displayed.

property.name: ProtectionType
property.doc: An enumeration representing the parts of a spreadsheet that can be protected from edits.

property.name: RelativeDate
property.doc: An enumeration of relative date options for calculating a value to be used in date-based BooleanCriteria.

property.name: TextDirection
property.doc: An enumeration of valid text directions.

property.name: TextToColumnsDelimiter
property.doc: An enumeration of the preset delimiters for split text to columns.

property.name: WrapStrategy
property.doc: An enumeration of the strategies used for wrapping cells.

method.name: create
method.doc: Creates a new spreadsheet with the given name.

argument.name: name
argument.doc: The name for the spreadsheet.

method.name: create
method.doc: Creates a new spreadsheet with the given name and the specified number of rows and columns.

argument.name: name
argument.doc: The name for the spreadsheet.

argument.name: rows
argument.doc: The number of rows for the spreadsheet.

argument.name: columns
argument.doc: The number of columns for the spreadsheet.

method.name: flush
method.doc: Applies all pending Spreadsheet changes.

method.name: getActive
method.doc: Returns the currently active spreadsheet, or null if there is none.

method.name: getActiveRange
method.doc: Returns the selected range in the active sheet, or null if there is no active range.

method.name: getActiveRangeList

method.name: getActiveSheet
method.doc: Gets the active sheet in a spreadsheet.

method.name: getActiveSpreadsheet

method.name: getCurrentCell
method.doc: Returns the current (highlighted) cell that is selected in one of the active ranges in the active sheet or null if there is no current cell.

method.name: getSelection

method.name: getUi
method.doc: Returns an instance of the spreadsheet's user-interface environment that allows the script to add features like menus, dialogs, and sidebars.

method.name: newDataValidation

argument.name: sheet

argument.name: restoreSelection
argument.doc: If true, the most recent selection of the new active sheet becomes selected again as the new sheet becomes active; if false, the new sheet becomes active without changing the current selection.

argument.name: newActiveSpreadsheet

spreadsheet.Banding.name: Banding
spreadsheet.Banding.doc: Access and modify bandings, the color patterns applied to rows or columns of a range. Each banding consists of a range and a set of colors for rows, columns, headers, and footers.

method.name: copyTo
method.doc: Copies this banding to another range.

argument.name: range
argument.doc: The range to copy this banding to.

method.name: getFirstRowColor

method.name: getFooterColumnColor

method.name: getFooterRowColor

method.name: getHeaderColumnColor

method.name: getRange

method.name: getSecondColumnColor
method.doc: Returns the second column color that is alternating, or null if no color is set.

method.name: getSecondRowColor

method.name: setHeaderRowColor
method.doc: Sets the color of the header row.

spreadsheet.BooleanCondition.name: BooleanCondition
spreadsheet.BooleanCondition.doc: Access boolean conditions in ConditionalFormatRules. Each conditional format rule may contain a single boolean condition. The boolean condition itself contains a boolean criteria (with values) and formatting settings. The criteria is evaluated against the content of a cell resulting in either a true or false value. If the criteria evaluates to true, the condition's formatting settings are applied to the cell.

method.name: getBackground
method.doc: Gets the background color string for this boolean condition.

method.name: getBold
method.doc: Returns true if this boolean condition bolds the text and returns false if this boolean condition removes bolding from the text.

method.name: getCriteriaType
method.doc: Gets the rule's criteria type as defined in the BooleanCriteria enum.

method.name: getCriteriaValues
method.doc: Gets an array of arguments for the rule's criteria.

method.name: getFontColor
method.doc: Gets the font color string for this boolean condition.

method.name: getItalic
method.doc: Returns true if this boolean condition italicises the text and returns false if this boolean condition removes italics from the text.

method.name: getStrikethrough
method.doc: Returns true if this boolean condition strikes through the text and returns false if this boolean condition removes strikethrough from the text.

method.name: getUnderline
method.doc: Returns true if this boolean condition underlines the text and returns false if this boolean condition removes underlining from the text.

spreadsheet.ConditionalFormatRule.name: ConditionalFormatRule
spreadsheet.ConditionalFormatRule.doc: Access conditional formatting rules. To create a new rule, use SpreadsheetApp.newConditionalFormatRule() and ConditionalFormatRuleBuilder. You can use Sheet.setConditionalFormatRules(rules) to set the rules for a given sheet.

method.name: copy
method.doc: Returns a rule builder preset with this rule's settings.

method.name: getBooleanCondition
method.doc: Retrieves the rule's BooleanCondition information if this rule uses boolean condition criteria.

method.name: getGradientCondition
method.doc: Retrieves the rule's GradientCondition information, if this rule uses gradient condition criteria.

method.name: getRanges
method.doc: Retrieves the ranges to which this conditional format rule is applied.

method.name: build
method.doc: Constructs a conditional format rule from the settings applied to the builder.

method.name: copy
method.doc: Returns a rule builder preset with this rule's settings.

method.name: getBooleanCondition
method.doc: Retrieves the rule's BooleanCondition information if this rule uses boolean condition criteria.

method.name: getGradientCondition
method.doc: Retrieves the rule's GradientCondition information, if this rule uses gradient condition criteria.

method.name: getRanges

method.name: setGradientMinpoint

method.name: setStrikethrough

spreadsheet.ContainerInfo.name: ContainerInfo
spreadsheet.ContainerInfo.doc: Access the chart's position within a sheet. Can be updated using the EmbeddedChart.modify() function.

spreadsheet.EmbeddedAreaChartBuilder.doc: Builder for area charts. For more details, see the Gviz documentation.

method.doc: Sets the strategy to use for hidden rows and columns.

argument.name: strategy
argument.doc: The strategy to use for hidden rows and columns.

method.name: setInitialSortingAscending
method.doc: Sets the index of the column according to which the table should be initially sorted (ascending).

argument.name: column
argument.doc: the number of the column according to which the table should be initially sorted

method.name: setInitialSortingDescending
method.doc: Sets the index of the column according to which the table should be initially sorted (descending).

argument.name: column
argument.doc: the number of the column according to which the table should be initially sorted

method.name: setMergeStrategy
method.doc: Sets the merge strategy to use when more than one range exists.

argument.name: mergeStrategy
argument.doc: The merge strategy to use.

method.name: setNumHeaders
method.doc: Sets the number of rows or columns of the range that should be treated as headers.

argument.name: headers
argument.doc: The number of rows or columns to treat as headers. Negative values cause headers to be auto-detected.

method.name: setOption
method.doc: Sets advanced options for this chart.

argument.name: option
argument.doc: The name of the option.

argument.name: value
argument.doc: The value of the option.

method.name: setPosition
method.doc: Sets the position, changing where the chart appears on the sheet.

argument.name: anchorRowPos
argument.doc: The chart's top side is anchored in this row.

argument.name: anchorColPos
argument.doc: The chart's left side is anchored in this column.

argument.name: offsetX
argument.doc: The chart's upper right-hand corner is offset by this many pixels.

argument.name: offsetY
argument.doc: The chart's lower left-hand corner is offset by this many pixels.

method.name: setTransposeRowsAndColumns
method.doc: Sets whether the chart's rows and columns are transposed.

argument.name: transpose
argument.doc: If true, the rows and columns used to construct the chart are transposed.

method.name: showRowNumberColumn
method.doc: Sets whether to show the row number as the first column of the table.

argument.name: showRowNumber
argument.doc: true if the first column of the table should show the row number, false otherwise

method.name: useAlternatingRowStyle
method.doc: Sets whether alternating color style will be assigned to odd and even rows of a table chart.

argument.name: alternate
argument.doc: true if color styles should be alternating, false otherwise

spreadsheet.Filter.name: Filter
spreadsheet.Filter.doc: Access and modify existing filters. To create a new filter, use Range.createFilter().

method.name: getColumnFilterCriteria
method.doc: Gets the filter criteria on the specified column, or null if no filter criteria is set.

argument.name: columnPosition
argument.doc: The 1-indexed position of the column.

method.name: getRange
method.doc: Gets the range this filter is applied to.

method.name: remove
method.doc: Removes this filter.

method.name: removeColumnFilterCriteria
method.doc: Removes the filter criteria from the specified column.

argument.name: columnPosition
argument.doc: The 1-indexed position of the column.

method.name: setColumnFilterCriteria
method.doc: Sets the filter criteria on the specified column.

argument.name: columnPosition
argument.doc: The 1-indexed position of the column.

argument.name: filterCriteria
argument.doc: The filter criteria to set. If null, remove filter criteria from the specified column; alternatively, use removeColumnFilterCriteria(columnPosition).

method.name: sort
method.doc: Sorts the filtered range by the specified column, excluding the first row (the header row) in the range this filter is applied to.

argument.name: columnPosition
argument.doc: The 1-indexed position of the column.

argument.name: ascending
argument.doc: If true, sort the filtered range in ascending order; if false, sort the filtered range in descending order.

spreadsheet.FilterCriteria.name: FilterCriteria
spreadsheet.FilterCriteria.doc: Access filter criteria. To create a new criteria, use SpreadsheetApp.newFilterCriteria() and FilterCriteriaBuilder.

method.name: copy
method.doc: Creates a builder for a filter criteria based on this filter criteria's settings.

method.name: getCriteriaType
method.doc: Returns the boolean criteria type as defined in the BooleanCriteria enum.

method.name: getCriteriaValues
method.doc: Returns an array of arguments for the boolean criteria.

method.name: getHiddenValues
method.doc: Returns the values to hide.

method.name: getVisibleValues
method.doc: Returns the values to show.

method.name: build
method.doc: Constructs a filter criteria from the settings supplied to the builder.

method.name: copy
method.doc: Creates a builder for a filter criteria based on this filter criteria's settings.

method.name: getCriteriaType
method.doc: Returns the boolean criteria type as defined in the BooleanCriteria enum.

method.name: getCriteriaValues
method.doc: Returns an array of arguments for the boolean criteria.

method.name: getHiddenValues
method.doc: Returns the values to hide.

method.name: getVisibleValues
method.doc: Returns the values to show.

method.name: setHiddenValues
method.doc: Sets the values to hide.

argument.name: values
argument.doc: The list of values to hide.

method.name: setVisibleValues
method.doc: Sets the values to show.

argument.name: values
argument.doc: The list of values to show.

method.name: whenCellEmpty
method.doc: Sets the filter criteria to show cells where the cell is empty.

method.name: whenCellNotEmpty
method.doc: Sets the filter criteria to show cells where the cell is not empty.

method.name: whenDateAfter
method.doc: Sets the filter criteria to show cells where the cell date is after the specified value.

method.name: whenDateAfter
method.doc: Sets the filter criteria to show cells where the cell date is after the specified relative date.

argument.name: date
argument.doc: The latest date relative to the date type selected.

method.name: whenDateBefore
method.doc: Sets the filter criteria to show cells where the cell date is before the specified date.

method.name: whenDateBefore
method.doc: Sets the filter criteria to show cells where a cell date is before the specified relative date.

argument.name: date
argument.doc: The latest date relative to the date type selected.

method.name: whenDateEqualTo
method.doc: Sets the filter criteria to show cells where a cell date is equal to the specified date.

method.name: whenDateEqualTo
method.doc: Sets the filter criteria to show cells where a cell date is equal to the specified relative date.

argument.name: date
argument.doc: The latest date relative to the date type selected.

method.name: whenFormulaSatisfied
method.doc: Sets the filter criteria to show cells where the specified formula (such as =B:B<C:C) evaluates to true.

argument.name: formula
argument.doc: A custom formula that evaluates to true if the input is valid.

method.name: whenNumberBetween
method.doc: Sets the filter criteria to show cells where the cell number is falls between, or is either of, two specified numbers.

argument.name: start
argument.doc: The lowest acceptable value.

argument.name: end
argument.doc: The highest acceptable value.

method.name: whenNumberEqualTo
method.doc: Sets the filter criteria to show cells where the cell number is equal to the specified value.

argument.name: number
argument.doc: The sole acceptable value.

method.name: whenNumberGreaterThan
method.doc: Sets the filter criteria to show cells where the cell number is greater than the specified value.

argument.name: number
argument.doc: The highest unacceptable value.

method.name: whenNumberGreaterThanOrEqualTo
method.doc: Sets the filter criteria to show cells where the cell number is greater than or equal to the specified value.

argument.name: number
argument.doc: The lowest acceptable value.

method.name: whenNumberLessThan
method.doc: Sets the conditional conditional format rule to show cells where the cell number is less than the specified value.

argument.name: number
argument.doc: The lowest unacceptable value.

method.name: whenNumberLessThanOrEqualTo
method.doc: Sets the filter criteria to show cells where the cell number is less than or equal to the specified value.

argument.name: number
argument.doc: The highest acceptable value.

method.name: whenNumberNotBetween
method.doc: Sets the filter criteria to show cells where the cell number does not fall between, and is neither of, two specified numbers.

argument.name: start
argument.doc: The lowest unacceptable value.

argument.name: end
argument.doc: The highest unacceptable value.

method.name: whenNumberNotEqualTo
method.doc: Sets the filter criteria to show cells where the cell number is not equal to the specified value.

argument.name: number
argument.doc: The sole unacceptable value.

method.name: whenTextContains
method.doc: Sets the filter criteria to show cells where the cell text contains the specified text.

argument.name: text
argument.doc: The value that the input must contain.

method.name: whenTextDoesNotContain
method.doc: Sets the filter criteria to show cells where the cell text does not contain the specified text.

argument.name: text
argument.doc: The value that the input must not contain.

method.name: whenTextEndsWith
method.doc: Sets the filter criteria to show cells where the cell text ends with the specified text.

argument.name: text
argument.doc: Text to compare against the end of the string.

method.name: whenTextEqualTo
method.doc: Sets the filter criteria to show cells where the cell text is equal to the specified text.

argument.name: text
argument.doc: The sole acceptable value.

method.name: whenTextStartsWith
method.doc: Sets the filter criteria to show cells where the cell text starts with the specified text.

argument.name: text
argument.doc: Text to compare against the beginning of the string.

method.name: withCriteria
method.doc: Sets the boolean criteria to criteria defined by BooleanCriteria values, typically taken from the criteria and arguments of an existing criteria.

argument.name: criteria
argument.doc: The type of boolean criteria.

argument.name: args
argument.doc: An array of arguments appropriate to the criteria type; the number of arguments and their type match the corresponding when...() method above.

spreadsheet.GradientCondition.name: GradientCondition
spreadsheet.GradientCondition.doc: Access gradient (color) conditions in ConditionalFormatRuleApis. Each conditional format rule may contain a single gradient condition. A gradient condition is defined by three points along a number scale (min, mid, and max), each of which has a color, a value, and a InterpolationType. The content of a cell is compared to the values in the number scale and the color applied to the cell is interpolated based on the cell content's proximity to the gradient condition min, mid, and max points.

method.name: getMaxColor
method.doc: Gets the color set for the maximum value of this gradient condition.

method.name: getMaxType
method.doc: Gets the interpolation type for the maximum value of this gradient condition.

method.name: getMaxValue
method.doc: Gets the max value of this gradient condition.

method.name: getMidColor
method.doc: Gets the color set for the mid-point value of this gradient condition.

method.name: getMidType
method.doc: Gets the interpolation type for the mid-point value of this gradient condition.

method.name: getMidValue
method.doc: Gets the mid-point value of this gradient condition.

method.name: getMinColor
method.doc: Gets the color set for the minimum value of this gradient condition.

method.name: getMinType
method.doc: Gets the interpolation type for the minimum value of this gradient condition.

method.name: getMinValue
method.doc: Gets the minimum value of this gradient condition.

spreadsheet.Group.name: Group
spreadsheet.Group.doc: Access and modify spreadsheet groups. Groups are an association between an interval of contiguous rows or columns that can be expanded or collapsed as a unit to hide/show the rows or columns. Each group has a control toggle on the row or column directly before or after the group (depending on settings) that can expand or collapse the group as a whole.

method.name: collapse
method.doc: Collapses this group.

method.name: expand
method.doc: Expands this group.

method.name: getControlIndex
method.doc: Returns the control toggle index of this group.

method.name: getDepth
method.doc: Returns the depth of this group.

method.name: getRange
method.doc: Returns the range over which this group exists.

method.name: isCollapsed
method.doc: Returns true if this group is collapsed.

method.name: remove
method.doc: Removes this group from the sheet, reducing the group depth of the range by one.

spreadsheet.NamedRange.name: NamedRange
spreadsheet.NamedRange.doc: Create, access and modify named ranges in a spreadsheet. Named ranges are ranges that have associated string aliases. They can be viewed and edited via the Sheets UI under the Data > Named ranges... menu.

method.name: getName
method.doc: Gets the name of this named range.

method.name: getRange
method.doc: Gets the range referenced by this named range.

method.name: remove
method.doc: Deletes this named range.

method.name: setName
method.doc: Sets/updates the name of the named range.

argument.name: name
argument.doc: The new name of the named range.

method.name: setRange
method.doc: Sets/updates the range for this named range.

argument.name: range
argument.doc: The spreadsheet range to associate with this named range.

spreadsheet.PageProtection.name: PageProtection
spreadsheet.PageProtection.doc: Deprecated. For spreadsheets created in the newer version of Google Sheets, use the more powerful Protection class instead. Although this class is deprecated, it remains available for compatibility with the older version of Sheets.

method.name: addUser
method.doc: Adds a user to the list of users who can edit the sheet, if it is protected.

argument.name: email
argument.doc: The email of the user to add.

method.name: getUsers
method.doc: Returns a list of the email addresses of the users who can edit this sheet.

method.name: isProtected
method.doc: Indicates whether the sheet has sheet protection enabled or not.

method.name: removeUser
method.doc: Removes a user from the list of users who can edit the sheet.

argument.name: user
argument.doc: The email address of the user to remove.

method.name: setProtected
method.doc: Sets the protection status for the sheet.

argument.name: protection
argument.doc: true to enable sheet protection, false to disable sheet protection.

spreadsheet.PivotFilter.name: PivotFilter
spreadsheet.PivotFilter.doc: Access and modify pivot table filters.

method.name: getFilterCriteria
method.doc: Returns the filter criteria for this pivot filter.

method.name: getPivotTable
method.doc: Returns the PivotTable that this filter belongs to.

method.name: getSourceDataColumn
method.doc: Returns the number of the source data column this filter operates on.

method.name: remove
method.doc: Removes this pivot filter from the pivot table.

method.name: setFilterCriteria
method.doc: Sets the filter criteria for this pivot filter.

argument.name: filterCriteria
argument.doc: The filter criteria to set.

spreadsheet.PivotGroup.name: PivotGroup
spreadsheet.PivotGroup.doc: Access and modify pivot table breakout groups.

method.name: addManualGroupingRule
method.doc: Adds a manual grouping rule for this pivot group.

argument.name: groupName
argument.doc: The name of this grouping rule.

argument.name: groupMembers
argument.doc: The values that are included in this grouping rule.

method.name: areLabelsRepeated
method.doc: Returns whether labels are displayed as repeated.

method.name: clearGroupingRule
method.doc: Removes any grouping rules from this pivot group.

method.name: clearSort
method.doc: Removes any sorting applied to this group.

method.name: getDimension
method.doc: Returns whether this is a row or column group.

method.name: getIndex
method.doc: Returns the index of this pivot group in the current group order.

method.name: getPivotTable
method.doc: Returns the PivotTable which this grouping belongs to.

method.name: getSourceDataColumn
method.doc: Returns the number of the source data column this group summarizes.

method.name: hideRepeatedLabels
method.doc: Hides repeated labels for this grouping.

method.name: isSortAscending
method.doc: Returns true if the sort is ascending, returns false if the sort order is descending.

method.name: moveToIndex
method.doc: Moves this group to the specified position in the current list of row or column groups.

argument.name: index
argument.doc: The index to move this grouping to.

method.name: remove
method.doc: Removes this pivot group from the table.

method.name: removeManualGroupingRule
method.doc: Removes the manual grouping rule with the specified groupName.

argument.name: groupName
argument.doc: The name of the grouping rule to remove.

method.name: resetDisplayName
method.doc: Resets the display name of this group in the pivot table to its default value.

method.name: setDisplayName
method.doc: Sets the display name of this group in the pivot table.

argument.name: name
argument.doc: The display name to set.

method.name: setHistogramGroupingRule
method.doc: Sets a histogram grouping rule for this pivot group.

argument.name: minValue
argument.doc: The minimum value for items to be placed into buckets. Values less than this are combined into a single bucket.

argument.name: maxValue
argument.doc: The maximum value for items to be placed into buckets. Values greater than this are combined into a single bucket.

method.name: showRepeatedLabels
method.doc: When there is more than one row or column grouping, this method displays this grouping's label for each entry of the subsequent grouping.

method.name: showTotals
method.doc: Sets whether to show total values for this pivot group in the table.

argument.name: showTotals
argument.doc: Whether to show totals or not.

method.name: sortAscending
method.doc: Sets the sort order to be ascending.

method.name: sortBy
method.doc: Sorts this group by the specified PivotValue for the values from the oppositeGroupValues.

argument.name: value
argument.doc: The pivot value to sort by.

argument.name: oppositeGroupValues
argument.doc: The values of an opposite pivot group (a column group if sorting a row group, or a row group if sorting a column group) that are used to sort. The order of these values determines precedence for tie breaking.

method.name: sortDescending
method.doc: Sets the sort order to be descending.

method.name: totalsAreShown
method.doc: Returns whether total values are currently shown for this pivot group.

method.name: addCalculatedPivotValue
method.doc: Creates a new pivot value in the pivot table calculated from the specified formula with the specified name.

argument.name: name
argument.doc: The name for this calculated pivot value.

argument.name: formula
argument.doc: The formula used to calculate this value.

method.name: addColumnGroup
method.doc: Defines a new pivot column grouping in the pivot table.

argument.name: sourceDataColumn
argument.doc: The number of the column this group summarizes. This index represents the absolute number of the column in the spreadsheet; 1 representing column "A," 2 representing column B, etc.

method.name: addFilter
method.doc: Creates a new pivot filter for the pivot table.

argument.name: sourceDataColumn
argument.doc: The number of the column this group summarizes. This index represents the absolute number of the column in the spreadsheet; 1 representing column "A," 2 representing column B, etc.

argument.name: filterCriteria
argument.doc: The filter criteria used to perform the filtering.

method.name: addPivotValue
method.doc: Defines a new pivot value in the pivot table with the specified summarizeFunction.

argument.name: sourceDataColumn
argument.doc: The number of the column this group summarizes. This index represents the absolute number of the column in the spreadsheet; 1 representing column "A," 2 representing column B, etc.

method.name: addRowGroup
method.doc: Defines a new pivot row grouping in the pivot table.

argument.name: sourceDataColumn
argument.doc: The number of the column this group summarizes. This index represents the absolute number of the column in the spreadsheet; 1 representing column "A," 2 representing column B, etc.

method.name: getAnchorCell
method.doc: Returns the Range representing the cell where this pivot table is anchored.

method.name: getColumnGroups
method.doc: Returns an ordered list of the column groups in this pivot table.

method.name: getFilters
method.doc: Returns an ordered list of the filters in this pivot table.

method.name: getPivotValues
method.doc: Returns an ordered list of the pivot values in this pivot table.

method.name: getRowGroups
method.doc: Returns an ordered list of the row groups in this pivot table.

method.name: getValuesDisplayOrientation
method.doc: Returns whether values are displayed as rows or columns.

method.name: remove
method.doc: Deletes this pivot table.

method.name: setValuesDisplayOrientation
method.doc: Sets the layout of this pivot table to display values as columns or rows.

argument.name: dimension
argument.doc: The dimension indicating how to display pivot values.

spreadsheet.PivotValue.name: PivotValue
spreadsheet.PivotValue.doc: Access and modify value groups in pivot tables.

method.name: getDisplayType
method.doc: Returns the display type describing how this pivot value is currently displayed in the table.

method.name: getFormula
method.doc: Returns the formula used to calculate this value.

method.name: getPivotTable
method.doc: Returns the PivotTable which this value belongs to.

method.name: getSummarizedBy
method.doc: Returns this groups summarization function.

method.name: setDisplayName
method.doc: Sets the display name for this value in the pivot table.

argument.name: name
argument.doc: The display name to set.

method.name: setFormula
method.doc: Sets the formula used to calculate this value.

argument.name: formula
argument.doc: The formula to use to calculate this value.

method.name: showAs
method.doc: Displays this value in the pivot table as a function of another value.

argument.name: displayType
argument.doc: The way to display the values.

method.name: summarizeBy
method.doc: Sets the summarization function.

argument.name: summarizeFunction
argument.doc: The function to use to summarize data in this value's source data column.

spreadsheet.Protection.name: Protection
spreadsheet.Protection.doc: Access and modify protected ranges and sheets. A protected range can protect either a static range of cells or a named range. A protected sheet may include unprotected regions. For spreadsheets created with the older version of Google Sheets, use the PageProtection class instead.

method.name: addEditor
method.doc: Adds the given user to the list of editors for the protected sheet or range.

argument.name: emailAddress
argument.doc: The email address of the user to add.

method.name: addEditor
method.doc: Adds the given user to the list of editors for the protected sheet or range.

argument.name: user
argument.doc: A representation of the user to add.

method.name: addEditors
method.doc: Adds the given array of users to the list of editors for the protected sheet or range.

argument.name: emailAddresses
argument.doc: An array of email addresses of the users to add.

method.name: canDomainEdit
method.doc: Determines whether all users in the domain that owns the spreadsheet have permission to edit the protected range or sheet.

method.name: canEdit
method.doc: Determines whether the user has permission to edit the protected range or sheet.

method.name: getDescription
method.doc: Gets the description of the protected range or sheet.

method.name: getEditors
method.doc: Gets the list of editors for the protected range or sheet.

method.name: getProtectionType
method.doc: Gets the type of the protected area, either RANGE or SHEET.

method.name: getRange
method.doc: Gets the range that is being protected.

method.name: getRangeName
method.doc: Gets the name of the protected range if it is associated with a named range.

method.name: getUnprotectedRanges
method.doc: Gets an array of unprotected ranges within a protected sheet.

method.name: isWarningOnly
method.doc: Determines if the protected area is using "warning based" protection.

method.name: remove
method.doc: Unprotects the range or sheet.

method.name: removeEditor
method.doc: Removes the given user from the list of editors for the protected sheet or range.

argument.name: emailAddress
argument.doc: The email address of the user to remove.

method.name: removeEditor
method.doc: Removes the given user from the list of editors for the protected sheet or range.

argument.name: user
argument.doc: A representation of the user to remove.

method.name: removeEditors
method.doc: Removes the given array of users from the list of editors for the protected sheet or range.

argument.name: emailAddresses
argument.doc: An array of email addresses of the users to remove.

method.name: setDescription
method.doc: Sets the description of the protected range or sheet.

argument.name: description
argument.doc: The description of the protected range or sheet.

method.name: setDomainEdit
method.doc: Sets whether all users in the domain that owns the spreadsheet have permission to edit the protected range or sheet.

argument.name: editable
argument.doc: true if all users in the domain that owns the spreadsheet should have permission to edit the protected range or sheet; false if not.

method.name: setNamedRange
method.doc: Associates the protected range with an existing named range.

argument.name: namedRange
argument.doc: The existing named range to associate with the protected range.

method.name: setRange
method.doc: Adjusts the range that is being protected.

argument.name: range
argument.doc: The new range to protect from edits.

method.name: setRangeName
method.doc: Associates the protected range with an existing named range.

argument.name: rangeName
argument.doc: The name of the named range to be protected.

method.name: setUnprotectedRanges
method.doc: Unprotects the given array of ranges within a protected sheet.

argument.name: ranges
argument.doc: The array of ranges to leave unprotected within a protected sheet.

method.name: setWarningOnly
method.doc: Sets whether or not this protected range is using "warning based" protection.

spreadsheet.Range.name: Range
spreadsheet.Range.doc: Access and modify spreadsheet ranges. A range can be a single cell in a sheet or a group of adjacent cells in a sheet.

method.name: activate
method.doc: Sets the specified range as the active range, with the top left cell in the range as the current cell.

method.name: activateAsCurrentCell
method.doc: Sets the specified cell as the current cell.

method.name: applyColumnBanding
method.doc: Applies a default column banding theme to the range.

method.name: applyColumnBanding
method.doc: Applies a specified column banding theme to the range.

argument.name: bandingTheme
argument.doc: A color theme to apply to the columns in the range.

method.name: applyColumnBanding
method.doc: Applies a specified column banding theme to the range with specified header and footer settings.

argument.name: bandingTheme
argument.doc: A color theme to apply to the columns in the range.

argument.name: showHeader
argument.doc: If true, the banding theme header color is applied to the first column.

argument.name: showFooter
argument.doc: If true, the banding theme footer color is applied to the last column.

method.name: applyRowBanding
method.doc: Applies a default row banding theme to the range.

method.name: applyRowBanding
method.doc: Applies a specified row banding theme to the range.

argument.name: bandingTheme
argument.doc: A color theme to apply to the rows in the range.

method.name: applyRowBanding
method.doc: Applies a specified row banding theme to the range with specified header and footer settings.

argument.name: bandingTheme
argument.doc: A color theme to apply to the rows in the range.

argument.name: showHeader
argument.doc: If true, the banding theme header color is applied to the first row.

argument.name: showFooter
argument.doc: If true, the banding theme footer color is applied to the last row.

method.name: autoFill
method.doc: Fills the destinationRange with data based on the data in this range.

argument.name: destination
argument.doc: The range to be auto-filled with values. The destination range should contain this range and extend it in only one direction (upwards, downwards, left, or right).

argument.name: series
argument.doc: The type of autoFill series that should be used to calculate new values. The effect of this series differs based on the type and amount of source data.

method.name: autoFillToNeighbor
method.doc: Calculates a range to fill with new data based on neighboring cells and automatically fills that range with new values based on the data contained in this range.

argument.name: series
argument.doc: The type of autoFill series that should be used to calculate new values. The effect of this series differs based on the type and amount of source data.

method.name: breakApart
method.doc: Break any multi-column cells in the range into individual cells again.

method.name: canEdit
method.doc: Determines whether the user has permission to edit every cell in the range.

method.name: clear
method.doc: Clears the range of contents, formats, and data validation rules.

method.name: clear
method.doc: Clears the range of contents, format, data validation rules, and/or comments, as specified with the given advanced options.

argument.name: options
argument.doc: A JavaScript object that specifies advanced parameters, as listed below.

method.name: clearContent
method.doc: Clears the content of the range, leaving the formatting intact.

method.name: clearDataValidations
method.doc: Clears the data validation rules for the range.

method.name: clearFormat
method.doc: Clears formatting for this range.

method.name: clearNote
method.doc: Clears the note in the given cell or cells.

method.name: collapseGroups
method.doc: Collapses all groups that are wholly contained within the range.

method.name: copyFormatToRange
method.doc: Copy the formatting of the range to the given location.

argument.name: gridId
argument.doc: The unique ID of the sheet within the spreadsheet, irrespective of position.

argument.name: column
argument.doc: The first column of the target range.

argument.name: columnEnd
argument.doc: The end column of the target range.

argument.name: row
argument.doc: The start row of the target range.

argument.name: rowEnd
argument.doc: The end row of the target range.

method.name: copyFormatToRange
method.doc: Copy the formatting of the range to the given location.

argument.name: sheet
argument.doc: The target sheet.

spreadsheet.Selection.name: Selection
spreadsheet.Selection.doc: Access the current active selection in the active sheet. A selection is the set of cells the user has highlighted in the sheet, which can be non-adjacent ranges. One cell in the selection is the current cell, where the user's current focus is. The current cell is highlighted with a darker border in the Google Sheets UI.

method.name: getActiveRange
method.doc: Returns the selected range in the active sheet, or null if there is no active range.

method.name: getActiveRangeList

method.name: getNextDataRange
method.doc: Starting from the current cell and active range and moving in the given direction, returns an adjusted range where the appropriate edge of the range has been shifted to cover the next data cell while still covering the current cell.

argument.name: direction
argument.doc: The direction in which to find the next data region edge cell.

argument.name: columnSpec
argument.doc: A range spanning the columns that should be moved.

argument.name: destinationIndex
argument.doc: The index that the columns should be moved to. Note that this index is based on the coordinates before the columns are moved. Existing data is shifted right to make room for the moved columns while the source columns are removed from the grid. Therefore, the data may end up at a different index than originally specified.

method.name: moveRows
method.doc: Moves the rows selected by the given range to the position indicated by the destinationIndex.

argument.name: rowSpec
argument.doc: A range spanning the rows that should be moved.

argument.name: destinationIndex
argument.doc: The index that the rows should be moved to. Note that this index is based on the coordinates before the rows are moved. Existing data is shifted down to make room for the moved rows while the source rows are removed from the grid. Therefore, the data may end up at a different index than originally specified.

property.name: STDEVP
property.doc: The STDEVP function

property.name: VAR
property.doc: The VAR function

property.name: VARP
property.doc: The VARP function

spreadsheet.PivotValueDisplayType.name: PivotValueDisplayType
spreadsheet.PivotValueDisplayType.doc: An enumeration of ways to display a pivot value as a function of another value.

property.name: DEFAULT
property.doc: Default. Displays pivot values as the actual value and not as a function of another value.

property.name: PERCENT_OF_ROW_TOTAL
property.doc: Displays pivot values as a percent of the total for that row.

property.name: PERCENT_OF_COLUMN_TOTAL
property.doc: Displays pivot values as a percent of the total for that column.

property.name: PERCENT_OF_GRAND_TOTAL
property.doc: Displays pivot values as a percent of the grand total.

spreadsheet.ProtectionType.name: ProtectionType
spreadsheet.ProtectionType.doc: An enumeration representing the parts of a spreadsheet that can be protected from edits.

property.name: RANGE
property.doc: Protection for a range.

property.name: SHEET
property.doc: Protection for a sheet.

spreadsheet.RelativeDate.name: RelativeDate
spreadsheet.RelativeDate.doc: An enumeration representing the relative date options for calculating a value to be used in date-based BooleanCriteria.

property.name: TODAY
property.doc: Dates compared against the current date.

property.name: TOMORROW
property.doc: Dates compared against the date after the current date.

property.name: YESTERDAY
property.doc: Dates compared against the date before the current date.

property.name: PAST_WEEK
property.doc: Dates that fall within the past week period.

property.name: PAST_MONTH
property.doc: Dates that fall within the past month period.

property.name: PAST_YEAR
property.doc: Dates that fall within the past year period.

property.name: LEFT_TO_RIGHT
property.doc: Left-to-right text direction.

property.name: RIGHT_TO_LEFT
property.doc: Right-to-left text direction.

spreadsheet.TextToColumnsDelimiter.name: TextToColumnsDelimiter
spreadsheet.TextToColumnsDelimiter.doc: An enumeration of the types of preset delimiters that can split a column of text into multiple columns.

property.name: COMMA
property.doc: "," delimiter.

property.name: SEMICOLON
property.doc: ";" delimiter.

property.name: PERIOD
property.doc: "." delimiter.

property.name: SPACE
property.doc: " " delimiter.

spreadsheet.WrapStrategy.name: WrapStrategy
spreadsheet.WrapStrategy.doc: An enumeration of the strategies used to handle cell text wrapping.

property.name: WRAP
property.doc: Wrap lines that are longer than the cell width onto a new line. Single words that are longer than a line are wrapped at the character level.

property.name: OVERFLOW
property.doc: Overflow lines into the next cell, so long as that cell is empty. If the next cell over is non-empty, this behaves the same as CLIP.

property.name: CLIP
property.doc: Clip lines that are longer than the cell width.
